abstract: Calvin Hollins Jr and Dwain Kyles, owners of Chicago nightclub E2 where 21 people died in stairwell stampede in 2003, are sentenced to two years probation; men were convicted in 2009 of criminal contempt for violating judge's order to close club due to building code violations in months before tragedy.
lead_paragraph: The two owners of a Chicago nightclub where 21 people were crushed to death or asphyxiated in a stairwell in 2003 were sentenced to two years of probation.

headline.main: Illinois: Probation for Owners of Club Where 21 Died
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Probation for Owners of Club Where 21 Died
